channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Small pile of asbestos roofing, 21st January
item.description:
A pile of roofing, which appears to be corrugated asbestos has been left on the side of the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole at the top of Badgeworth bridge, 21st January
item.description:
There is a really deep pothole towards the left side of the road as we reach the top of the bridge driving from Badgeworth towards Reddings. As the road narrows at this point, drivers trying to avoid the pothole are having to veer right straight onto oncoming traffic, and both sides have no visibility of each other at this point. This could result in a serious accident anytime. I had a near miss today. I’m aware that this bridge has had multiple fixes in recent years. However we’ve now seen a number of potholes appearing again up and down the bridge slopes. Please could you inspect and fix these urgently as this is a main thoroughfare and a bus route.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole on Grovefield way at pedestrian crossing, 21st January
item.description:
There is a deep pothole at the pedestrian crossing on Grovefield way on the left carriageway while driving from Arle court towards Symphony road. This is situated just before turning left into Symphony road. The position of the pothole is towards the right side of the crossing and it caused damage to my car’s front right tyre and wheel rim. I request you to kindly check and fill this pothole at the earliest.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grovefield Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge gigantic big crater, 21st January
item.description:
Big crack in the road, pretty soon we will need a bridge to get over it. Almost broke the front end of my partners car
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andover Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Series of potholes on Badgeworth bridge, 21st January
item.description:
There are a series of potholes at the bottom of the slope of the Badgeworth bridge on the left carriageway while travelling from Badgeworth towards the Reddings. The camber on the road and oncoming traffic forces vehicles to drive straight into these potholes, resulting in damages to the front left tyres. Please could you inspect these and fix the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding highway culvert on footpath, 21st January
item.description:
Mh cover located at front of Roseville is flooding out and overflowing in heavy rain. Severn Trent have attended and this is not their issue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Impossible to avoid huge pothole in carriagway on bridge, 21st January
item.description:
On apex of humpback railway bridge in the left hand carriageway as you head from badgeworth towards arle court roundabout. Pothole is so large now that it cannot be avoided. Already causing vehicle damage despite several reports on this platform. It is now going to cause a road accident due to location of pothole, as drivers are moving into the oncoming carriageway on a blind apex to avoid it, or being thrown into the oncoming carriageway after hitting it when driving in the dark. GET IT FIXED! Dont rely on having photographs as this is a very dangerous section of the road to expect anyone to stop and take photographs at, just fix it as its been getting worse for months!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Length of cycle path down B4063 very muddy, 21st January
item.description:
This applies to a lot of the cycle path, but especially near gates on the field. For months now the path has been getting in increasingly poor condition, really needs sweeping as it's getting increasingly hazardous to cycle down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large depp pothole, 21st January
item.description:
On the left heading away from the village towards A435 just by the pedestrian safety island
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finlay Way, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole and damage on Lansdown Road, near jct with Lansdown Parade, 21st January
item.description:
Really large and deep pothole where Lansdown Road continues past Texaco petrol station towards Montpellier roundabout. The pothole is right as the traffic diverges, just after the junction with Lansdown parade. Really wide and square pothole, which could cause serious damage at speed. In the dark it’s really hard to see and requires swerving to avoid. Has been like this for weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole and failing repairs, Hewlett Road beside school, 21st January
item.description:
Potholes and road damage at the end of the row of parked cars along Hewlett Road, right by Berkhampstead School. Damage includes cracks, deep and wide pothole, and uneven road surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water flowing out of cottage verge causing significant water to flow onto road causing dangerous conditions., 21st January
item.description:
Bottom of cottage garden. Large amount of water flowing for over a year. This will be extremely dangerous if it freezes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole in Bethesda St., 21st January
item.description:
Large and deep pothole. Cars parked on one side of the road means it can’t be avoided when exiting Bath Rd car park
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Bath Street, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Floodwater at pedestrian crossing, 21st January
item.description:
Standing water sitting at pedestrian crossing- blocking access to the crossing button. The footpath is flooded and so pedestrians are forced to use the cycle path or grass next to the crossing. Unsafe. Close proximity to a school on a very busy junction. Unacceptable thst this has not been speedily rectified!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Central Cross Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Flooding/ Poor road surface, 21st January
item.description:
Between Gotherington railway bridge and turn off to Dixton. Even though there has been rain in the last 24 hours, when there hasn’t been this section of road takes ages to drain as there seems to be no drainage. It is a major hazard as cars drive in the middle of the road where theres some surface still visible to avoid the dangerous surface below the water. It really needs looking into asap as there’s going to be an accident sooner or later. The whole Gretton/ Gotherington Road needs resurfacing as there’s multiple issues.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Prescott, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Potholes and broken road surface, 21st January
